metadata.title: CVE-2024-39466 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:thermal/drivers/qcom/lmh: Check for SCM availability at probeUp until now, the necessary scm availability check has not beenperformed, leading to possible null pointer dereferences (which didhappen for me on RB1).Fix that.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-39466` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
